page.title: 07Corrugated Packing
page.content: The Corrugated Packing factory has been in business since 1965.The factory mainly produces gaskets for cars,Rolls-Royce and aeroplanes.They have a factory in America also.The raw materials come from Bristol,America and Germany.The small gaskets are pressed by hand,the large are done by machine.The small copper washers are made at 2-3000 per hour and cost 5p.The aircraft gaskets take 2-3 days to make and cost up to Â£50.The finished products go to I.C.I. Cleveland and Bristol.They use vans for local deliveries but on long distance deliveries they use British Rail or by road. The number of employees are 120 and there are 50 people at the Shotley Bridge factory plating.The average pay is Â£120.
